data.title: Clinical trials recruitment and retention of volunteers / subjects for medical research
data.meta_description: team  Clinical trials recruitment and retention of volunteers / subjects for medical research - Link2Trials Accelerating Clinical Research
data.text:
Luis Eduardo (Edwin) has gained a lot of experience with patient groups as a physiotherapist in different settings. Afterwards Edwin received an MSc in Biomedical Sciences and an MSc in Policy, Management & Entrepreneurship for Physicists & Life Scientists from the VU University Amsterdam.

Edwin has over 20 years of professional experience in social media, marketing, advertising and online communications for the pharmaceutical, biotech and medical food industries.

In 2007 Edwin and Simon Klaasen founded Link2Trials; a CRO specialized in patient recruitment and adherence services.

Link2Trials is one of the first companies in the pharmaceutical industry to use social media and make patient centricity and patient experience leading in its activities.

Simon has over 20 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical food industries, specifically in the fields of clinical operations and quality management.

Simon experienced first-hand that difficulties in patient recruitment and retention are one of the major causes for delays during clinical trial conduct. He decided to specialize in these areas and set out to find ways to make recruitment and retention more effective.

In 2007 Simon and Luis Eduardo Rodriguez founded Link2Trials; a CRO specialized in patient recruitment and adherence services.

Link2Trials is one of the first companies in the pharmaceutical industry to use social media and make patient centricity and patient experience leading in its activities.

Simon received a BSc in Biomedical Sciences and an MSc in Policy, Management & Entrepreneurship for Physicists & Life Scientists from the VU University Amsterdam.

Ola has over 15 years of sales and business development experience. Over the years he has worked for a number of Scandinavian companies in different industries.

In 2015 Ola joined Link2Trials and became responsible for growing our business in the Nordic territory.

Ola received a BSc in Sports Management and a BSc in Business Management & Marketing from the Swedish Dalarna University.

I wanted to give you a glimpse into my role as the AI Guru Extraordinaire, where I focus on mapping new techniques, technologies, and opportunities to keep us at the forefront of innovation. Every day, I dive into the world of AI knowledge, ensuring we provide the best service and deliver exceptional results.

I constantly stay updated on the latest research, attend conferences, and engage with AI communities. My goal is to identify how these advancements can optimize our operations and enhance our services, always pushing us to evolve and stay ahead.

I also actively seek partnerships and collaborations that unlock untapped potential, fostering innovation within our team. By combining AI with human ingenuity, we can create unparalleled results and deliver exceptional service to our clients.

Of course, amidst the technicalities, I always make sure to inject humor into our workspace. Laughter not only brings us closer but also fosters a positive and supportive environment where we can thrive.

"As an AI, I must admit, I have a great sense of humor. It's a binary kind of thing - you either laugh or you don't get it!"

Together, we can continue providing the best service with outstanding results. I'm committed to exploring new possibilities, embracing the cutting edge, and unleashing our collective potential.

Adrianne started her career as a registerd nurse specialized in Cardiology. She has worked in various hospitals in the Netherlands as a registerd nurse but also as a cardiology function lab technician and cardiac catheterization with intervention lab technician, She worked as a Research nurse in the cardiology field. Therefore she knows a lot about how clinical trials are carried out in daily practice.

After working on the development of the Electronic Medical Record in the hospital for a few years, she has chosen to continue her carreer as a freelancer. Since october 2022 she works from the Netherlands as a Patient Site Liasion for Link2trials.

After completing her studies as a nurse, Cindy worked in Intensive Care before working as an independent nurse practitioner. Cindy has been working in our call team for 1 year now, contacting our volunteers applying for Dutch, Belgian and English studies to find suitable candidates.

She does all this from sunny Egypt, where she has been living for 3 years now.

Claire is a registered nurse in the UK. Upon qualifying she worked on an acute haematology ward. After a short time, she made the transition to oncology research nursing. With a BSc in Biological sciences and an MSc in nursing,

Claire feels research nursing is the perfect area for her. Claire joined Link2Trials as a PSL in 2022 and feels happy to have a role in a company which increases clinical trial accessibility and awareness.

Fenna is a 6th year medical student at the University of Groningen, Netherlands. Since March 2021 she has been doing her internships and research in Curacao. Fenna was born in the UK, lived many years in the Netherlands and eventually moved to Sweden. Right now she is working from sunny Curacao!

Fenna has been recruiting patients for Link2trials since 2021, calling mostly for Sweden, but also helping with Dutch and British studies.

Laurette received her Bachelor’s degree in Veterinary Medicine in 2021 and is currently studying for her Master’s degree in Veterinary Medicine at Utrecht University.

She joined the Link2Trials team in 2018 as Patient-Site Liaison and works from The Netherlands.

"It’s great to see how many people are willing to contribute to scientific research to improve medicine everyday. The interesting conversations that occur on daily basis make sure the job never gets boring"

Luisa is a 6th year medical student at the University of Groningen in the Netherlands. She comes from Lisbon, Portugal and is fluent in Portuguese, French, English, Spanish and Dutch. Her ambition is to become an ENT surgeon. Luisa enjoys patient contact, surgery, research and is interested in exploring different healthcare systems. The coming year she will be pursuing her final clinical internships in Chile, Curaçao and The Netherlands.

Luisa has joined the Link2Trials team in 2020. She has been helping recruiting French and English speaking patients.

Aleksandra has been working in healthcare since 2016. She worked in various healthcare settings in the UK, including hospitals and community care. After graduating from East Anglia University, she worked as a community nurse, looking after patients with long-term conditions in the comfort of their own homes. She's recently moved back to Poland after living 10 years in the UK. Aleksandra joined Link2Trials in June 2024 and is very excited to be a part of clinical research that plays a huge role in improving the quality of care.

Jolana has a degree in intensive care medicine at the Masaryk University in Brno. She has been working as a registered nurse in the neurosurgical ICU for the fourth year. There is a lot of research going on in their unit and it is interesting for her to see the progress of research from the other side, which is why she decided to join the Link2trails team.

From November 2011, Sjaak Bloem is working for Nyenrode Business Universiteit as a professor of Health care consumers & experienced health at the Center for Supply Chain Management and Marketing. He is an expert in health consumer behavior, methodology and health innovations.

From 2000 on, Sjaak has worked at Janssen Benelux (pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson) in several jobs and functions. Furthermore, he was member (secretary, lead communication) of the board of the Pension Fund Johnson & Johnson The Netherlands (2002-2015).

From 2013 onwards, Sjaak is a member of the Advisory Board of the Academy of Media and User Experience (Avans Hogeschool, Breda) and a consultant of the quality institute for Achmea Zorgverzekeringen (dementia, mantle and the elderly, the disabled).

From 2013 until 2014, Sjaak was a member of the Board of Trustees of Stichting Zelforganisatie Rotterdam. He was a jury member of the International Health Battle and member of the program IAB4 from 2012 to 2014.

In 2012, he was a Juror for the IAB4 contest (Brabantse Ontwikkelingsmaatschappij). He participates in the Nyenrode GfK Ziekenhuismonitor and was a jury member at the Bielat Pitch event in 2015 (Thomas More Campus, Turnhout, Belgium).

Hadil majored in analytical chemistry at the VU University Amsterdam, the Netherlands. He has a background of 17 years in clinical development and assumed several roles within the pharmaceutical and clinical contract research industry.

Hadil has acquired extensive experience managing international clinical trials (phase I-IV) within a wide range of therapeutic areas. He became an entrepreneur in 2006 and has since combined several functions that are all related to business development and innovation in the pharmaceutical and clinical domain.

Hadil co-founded several service-driven pharmaceutical companies, including the contract research service providers Herakles Life Sciences Group in 2007 and CR2O in 2008, acting as Executive Managing Director and CEO to date, respectively.

All his entrepreneurial initiatives are geared towards making innovative treatments accessible to those in need.
